intro: Aria scandica, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Aria scandica has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a perennial species that produces small, showy flowers from late summer to early autumn.
